sentences.sContent: They saw a big flash and a huge ball of fire reaching hundreds of feet into the sky.
sentences.sCn: 他们看到一道强光和一个巨大的火球直冲天空达几百英尺。

sentences.sContent: After the pot is dipped in this mixture, it is fired.
sentences.sCn: 这个壶在混合料里浸过之后，就进行烧制。

synos.tran: 开火；烧制；解雇（fire的ing形式）；点燃；激励

phrases.pCn: 烧成温度；点火温度；发火点
射速；燃料用量；燃烧率，燃烧速度
点火时间；激发时间；燃烧时间

words.tran: 火；火灾；炮火；炉火；热情；激情；磨难
着火；射击；开枪；激动；烧火
点燃；解雇；开除；使发光；烧制；激动；放枪

trans.tranOther: Fire is the hot, bright flames produced by things that are burning
When a pot or clay object is fired, it is heated at a high temperature in a special oven, as part of the process of making it
